pages.text: Daisy loved her beautiful meadow home. But one morning, she noticed something wrong. Some of her flower friends looked droopy and sad!
"What's wrong, little flowers?" Daisy asked gently. She looked closely. Some flowers were in bright sunshine. Some were in cool shade. Some had wet soil. Some had dry soil.
Daisy had an idea! "Maybe different flowers need different things," she thought. She found a big leaf and carefully placed it over the hot, droopy flower. "Let's try this!"
The flower in the shade perked up! "You needed to be cooler!" Daisy said happily. "But I wonder... would some water help you even more?"
Daisy found a cupped leaf by the stream. She filled it with water and carefully carried it back. She let drops fall gently on the soil. Slowly, the flower stood up tall and bright!
Daisy smiled at all her healthy flowers. "Now I understand! Every flower needs something special - some need shade, some need sun, some need water. I can help them all grow!" And she did, every day.
